trans-unit.source: Amount of time to pause (in milliseconds).

seg-source.mrk: Amount of time to pause (in milliseconds).

target.mrk: Amount of time to pause (in milliseconds).

trans-unit.source: Maximum sleep time is 2147483647 milliseconds (24 days) and the minimum is 10 milliseconds. So using 1-9 will automatically default to 10 milliseconds.

seg-source.mrk: Maximum sleep time is 2147483647 milliseconds (24 days) and the minimum is 10 milliseconds.
So using 1-9 will automatically default to 10 milliseconds.

target.mrk: Maximum sleep time is 2147483647 milliseconds (24 days) and the minimum is 10 milliseconds.
So using 1-9 will automatically default to 10 milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: Due to internal implementation, the sleep time completion is checked every 10 milisseconds so the precision cannot be less than 10.

seg-source.mrk: Due to internal implementation, the sleep time completion is checked every 10 milisseconds so the precision cannot be less than 10.

target.mrk: Due to internal implementation, the sleep time completion is checked every 10 milisseconds so the precision cannot be less than 10.

trans-unit.source: Note that other running processes often affect the timing accuracy and so pauses are likely to last for slightly longer than requested.

seg-source.mrk: Note that other running processes often affect the timing accuracy and so pauses are likely to last for slightly longer than requested.

target.mrk: Note that other running processes often affect the timing accuracy and so pauses are likely to last for slightly longer than requested.
